sentences.en: A great clamour has arisen around the question of peace or war.
sentences.cn: 是和是战,闹得甚嚣尘上.

sentences.en: Fun, bustle, colour and clamour everywhere.
sentences.cn: 到处好玩, 到处热闹, 到处有声有色.

sentences.en: He raised a hand to still the clamour.
He shouted over the rising clamour of voices.
sentences.cn: 他在越来越嘈杂的人声中大声喊叫。

sentences.en: Kathryn's quiet voice stilled the clamour.
sentences.cn: 凯瑟琳平静的声音使得嘈杂声平息了下来。

sentences.en: She could hear a clamour in the road outside.
sentences.cn: 她能听得见外面路上的吵闹声。

sentences.en: The clamour of the church bells strikes my ears.
sentences.cn: 教堂钟声的喧闹声传到我的耳中.

sentences.en: The clamour of the heavy traffic gave you a headache.
sentences.cn: 来往车辆嘈杂的声浪使人头痛.

sentences.en: The clamour to draw a veil over the minister's extra-marital activities reeks of hypocrisy.
sentences.cn: 想要掩饰部长婚外情的喧嚣叫嚷之声让人倍感虚伪。

sentences.en: The crowd in back of Old Chen began to clamour.
sentences.cn: 陈老七背后的闲人们大噪起来.

sentences.en: The war also brought a new clamour for native writers.
sentences.cn: 内战也重新激起要求本土文学家的呼吁.

sentences.en: The whole army begins to clamour for the fosse to be filled up.
sentences.cn: 全军都开始叫嚷着要将壕堑填平.

sentences.en: There was a clamour of voices outside the office.
sentences.cn: 办公室外有人吵吵嚷嚷.

sentences.en: There was a great clamour for a swift ending of the war.
sentences.cn: 当时存在着要求迅速结束战争的巨大呼声.

sentences.en: There was a public outcry [ clamour ] .

words.tran_cn: 吵闹的；喧嚷的；紧急的；非常需要注意的
喧嚷，发喧嚣声；持续地喊声

trans.tran_cn: 喧哗声，喧闹，大声的要求或抗议
trans.tran_en: a very loud noise made by a large group of people or animals

trans.tran_cn: 大声（或吵闹）地要求,（尤指乱哄哄地）大声地喊叫，呼叫
